intro: Eriorhaphe, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the Asteraceae family. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, hairy, and often spiny leaves, which provide protection against herbivores. The flowers are typically yellow or orange and are arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Eriorhaphe species are native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Europe. They are often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions.
